clinical_study.brief_title: Implementing Peri-operative Mobile Application for Contactless Vital Signs
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing Peri-operative Mobile Application for Contactless Screening and Vital Signs Measurement (MAC-VITAL): A Proof of Concept Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The huge impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on global healthcare systems has prompted search for novel tools to stem the tide. New digital health tools can provide possible health solutions in this time of unprecedented medical crisis to mitigate the impact of this pandemic. This proof of concept study will determine the feasibility and effectiveness of implementing a mobile application for contactless measurement of vital signs (MAC-VITAL) such as blood pressure (BP), heart rate (HR), respiratory rate (RR), heart rate variability (HRV), oxyhemoglobin saturation (SpO2), and body mass index (BMI) from surgical patients peri-operatively. Contactless measurement of vital signs will bridge the current gap between virtual care and in-person medical assessments. This study aims to determine whether a mobile app can effectively measure vital signs without any person to person contact and how this technology can be implemented in a peri-operative setting during COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a prospective proof of concept study to be conducted at Toronto Western Hospital, and Toronto General Hospital, University Health Network, Toronto, Ontario. This proof of concept study will determine the feasibility and effectiveness of implementing a contactless mobile application to obtain vital signs, and BMI from patients in the peri-operative setting. Informed consent to participate in the study will be obtained.
Vital signs measurement will be obtained by the research staff using hospital standard medical devices and the Anura Research App will also be used to measure vital signs. Measurement will take place before surgery and post surgery (1 ±2hrs and 2 ±4hrs after surgery).

primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be measured by using both AnuraTM research app and standard medical grade Blood pressure machine pre-and post-operatively.
Heart rate will be measured by using both AnuraTM research app and standard medical grade Blood pressure machine pre-and post-operatively.
Breathing rate will be measured by using both AnuraTM research app and standard medical grade Blood pressure machine pre-and post-operatively.
Heart rate variability will be measured by using both AnuraTM research app and standard medical grade Blood pressure machine pre-and post-operatively.
Oxygen saturation will be measured by using both AnuraTM research app and standard medical grade Blood pressure machine pre-and post-operatively.
Body mass index (BMI: height and weight) by using Anura app and medical grade standard device

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled to undergoing elective inpatient surgery under general and/or regional anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Patients scheduled to undergoing elective inpatient surgery under general and/or regional anesthesia
- 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria
- Refusal to consent for the study
- Non-English speaking.
